description: On December 15, 2020, the head of the government of Cabo Verde announced that vaccination within the country will begin during the first quarter of 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)
type_vac_mix: This distribution policy is not about mixing and matching of different vaccines.
type_vac_who_pays: Vaccine is free for the individual
type_vac_loc: All medical institutions allowed to administer vaccines
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On February 11, 2021, the Board of the World Bank announced that Cabo Verde will be the first African country to receive a funding of five million US dollars for 400000 vaccines.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Effective March 28, 2020 the Government of Cabo Verde has declared a “State of Emergency” that will remain in place through April 17. The state of emergency will allow the government to enforce social-isolation and social-distancing measures more strictly and oblige non-essential businesses to close.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Effective March 28, 2020 the Government of Cabo Verde has declared a “State of Emergency” that will remain in place through April 17. The state of emergency will allow the government to enforce social-isolation and social-distancing measures more strictly and oblige non-essential businesses to close. UPDATE: The national state of emergency has ended at a national level on April 16th.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: The Cape Verdean Government has suspended all air connections from Italy for a period of three weeks, until March 20, but which may be extended.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of March 19,  the Government of Cabo Verde has suspended commercial passenger flights in and out of Cabo Verde, including flights to Portugal, Senegal, the United States, and other European countries, with limited exceptions for citizens returning home from Cabo Verde and for medical emergencies.  In addition, passengers on board cruise ships and sailboats will not be allowed to disembark.  The government announced that these restrictions will remain in place for three weeks and may be renewed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: As of March 19, non-Cabo Verdean citizens will not be permitted entry for a period of three weeks. This travel restriction will reviewed by the Government of Cabo Verde at the end of this period.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: '-March 18, 2020: The Cabo Verde Government decided to ban all air connections with Portugal and all European countries with COVID -19 cases, as well as with the United States, Brazil, Senegal, and Nigeria. Consequently, since this decision impacts all Cabo Verde Airlines routes, Cabo Verde Airlines will suspend all its flights from 18 March 2020 through 30 June 2020. -March 19, 2020: The Government of Cabo Verde has suspended commercial passenger flights in and out of Cabo Verde, including flights to Portugal, Senegal, the United States, and other European countries, with limited exceptions for citizens returning home from Cabo Verde and for medical emergencies. In addition, passengers onboard cruise ships and sailboats will not be allowed to disembark. The Government of Cabo Verde announced that these restrictions will remain in place for 3 weeks and may be renewed. -March 19, 2020: Non-Cabo Verdean citizens will not be permitted entry for a period of three weeks. This travel restriction will be reviewed by the Government of Cabo Verde and the end of the period.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: '-March 15, 2020: Cabo Verde has lab facilities to test for COVID – 19.- March 16, 2020: Tests are being made in Cabo Verde rather than abroad, by the Laboratório de Virologia de Cabo Verde in Praia. -- The health system is prepared to isolate those displaying symptoms within hospital rooms specifically prepared to quarantine those with suspected cases of COVID-19.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: In response to the dramatic increase in the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Boa Vista, the Prime Minister announced that the only exception to the current ban on inter-island movement of people is for those who are returning home to another island after being unable to travel due to the state of emergency.  Those requesting this exception to the travel ban also require testing to ensure they do not pose a risk to public health.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
In response to the dramatic increase in the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Boa Vista, the Prime Minister announced that the only exception to the current ban on inter-island movement of people is for those who are returning home to another island after being unable to travel due to the state of emergency.  Those requesting this exception to the travel ban also require testing to ensure they do not pose a risk to public health.
On May 1, the Cabo Verdean government extended the State of Emergency for the islands of Santiago and Boa Vista through May 14, as well as nation-wide restrictions on inter-island movement of people to prevent the spread of the COVID-19 virus. UPDATE: Extension of restriction on inter-island travel
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 19, the Ministry of Health [of Cabo Verde] announced that it may require individuals exposed to a COVID-19 case or those displaying symptoms to self-quarantine. Should you be required to self-isolate at home, it is advisable to ensure you maintain at least a two–week supply of food, water, and any essential medicines.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Individuals arriving from China (and possible other locations with person-to-person transmission), may be required to stay at home isolated from others for at least 14 days
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 26, the Prime Minister of Cabo Verde announced new restrictions to contain the spread of COVID-19 in the country including, but not limited to, the suspension of all air and maritime inter-island connections, with limited exceptions; the closure of all public services and public companies, except for essential services such as airports, ports, and hospitals; and reductions to local transportation services.  These measures are scheduled to go into effect at midnight on March 27 and continue through April 17.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: Cabo Verde’s State of Emergency has been extended through May 14 for Boa Vista and Santiago.  For the other islands – São Vicente, Santo Antão, São Nicolau, Sal, Maio, Fogo, and Brava – certain restrictions on businesses and public areas remain in effect under the “State of Calamity” designation.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: For the other islands – São Vicente, Santo Antão, São Nicolau, Sal, Maio, Fogo, and Brava – certain restrictions on businesses and public areas remain in effect under the “State of Calamity” designation.  Additionally, as of April 25, under Cabo Verdean law, all individuals outside their home are required to wear a facemask.
